channel.title: 2015/16 on Marc Deisenroth
channel.description: Recent content in 2015/16 on Marc Deisenroth

item.title: Intelligent Data Analysis and Probabilistic Inference (2015/16)
item.description:
Imperial College London (CO-493)

The course is co-taught by Duncan Gillies and Marc Deisenroth.

Syllabus

  • Bayes' Theorem and Bayesian Inference
  • Bayesian Decision Trees -Evidence and message passing
  • Inference in singly connected networks
  • Building networks from data
  • Cause and Independence
  • Model Accuracy
  • Approximate Inference
  • Exact Inference
  • Probability propagation in Join Trees
  • Probability distributions and parameter estimation
  • Graphical models
  • Gaussian mixture models, EM, model selection
  • Dimensionality reduction with PCA
  • Linear discriminant analysis
  • Sampling
  • Variational inference by Hugh Salimbeni

item.title: Mathematical Methods (2015/16)
item.description:
Imperial College London (CO-145)

The course aims to make students confident in using basic mathematical techniques for later year courses in Computing. The course is co-taught by Mahdi Cheraghchi and Marc Deisenroth.

Syllabus

  • Sequences, Series and Power Series (~8 lectures)
  • Complex Numbers (~2 lectures)
  • Linear Algebra (~9 lectures)
  • Calculus and Differential Equations (~2 lectures)

Lectures

  • Mondays, 16:00 – 18:00 (Huxley 311). No lecture on Graduation Day (19th October)
  • Tuesdays, 11:00 – 12:00 (Huxley 308)
  • Friday, 27rd November, 15:00-16:00 (Huxley 308)
  • Friday, 4th December, 15:00-16:00 (Huxley 308)

Tutorials (MMTs)

  • Wednesdays, 11:00 – 12:00
  • Wednesdays, 12:00 – 13:00
  • Thursdays, 16:00 – 17:00
  • Thursdays, 17:00-18:00
  • Fridays, 9:00 – 10:00
  • Fridays, 10:00 – 11:00

Tests

  • Diagnostic Test 1: Friday, 16th October, 10:00 – 11:00 (Huxley 308)
  • Diagnostic Test 2: Friday, 30th October, 10:00 – 11:00 (Huxley 308)
  • Christmas Test: Friday, 18th December

Introduction Lecture

Thursday, 8 October, 14:00-16:00 (Huxley 308)

Course Material

  • Summary of useful mathematical tools (prerequisites, by J Bradley and D de Jager)
  • Lecture notes
  • Gilbert Strang: Introduction to Linear Algebra. Wellesley-Cambridge Press, 2003.
  • Maths basics (by A Faisal)
